inn1.comm: shortish and on off, Guptill is up on his tippy toes to blunt it
nice and full and on off, Guptill bends forward and drops it defensively to cover
back of a length and ducks back in, Guptill sits back and works it behind square on the leg side
pitched and swings away outside off, Latham just watches it through to the keeper
back of a length and slanting away in the channel, Latham leaves it be
good length ball, disciplined line on middle, brings the left-hander forward. Patted in front of cover. Latham is eager to get off the mark... he has to wait, though
back of a length and holds its line on off, Guptill stands tall and punchily plays it back to the bowler
short and snakes back in off the seam, Guptill jabs at it and jams an inside edge onto the thigh, the unprotected part
good length and on off, 144ks, pushed to mid-off with a straight bat
back of a length and on off, Guptill keeps back and defends it.... he is yet to tee off
hurled in at 143ks, picked away off the hips through midwicket
pitched up and on a fourth-stump line, dabbed towards backward point
short and on off, Guptill rises tall and punches to mid-on
Pradeep explores the channel again, Guptill does not chase it. Left alone
back of a length and outside off, Guptill goes after this.. Jabbing punch into the covers
full and aimed at off, Guptill flicks to the right of mid-on for one
Latham gets forward and taps it towards point. He sends Guptill back
full and attacking the stumps, but Latham's forward defence intervenes
full and on the pads at 141ks, Guptill picks it up over midwicket. Guptill was aiming to launch it over the off side, but Chameera did well to chase the batsman
Chameera pulls his length back outside off, punched towards point
length and outside off, helped down to third man
back of a length and on off, clipped to leg
back of a length and ducks back in to hit the thigh
Guptill sets to work! Dug in short and outside off, Guptill steps away, creates ample leverage and nails a pull over midwicket; first boundary of the match
pitched up and outside off, driven past mid-off for one
full and outside off, Guptill makes room and launches it over the covers. He holds his pose and admires the strike... #the boss
full and on middle and leg, tapped to mid-on
a tad overpitched on middle, Latham unfurls an impressive drive. He hits on the up, ram-rod straight drive, forces Guptill to take evasive action
back of a length, punched to mid-off
glanced off the pads to long leg
pitched up and width outside off, Latham leans on the drive and caresses it past the covers. Away she whistles to the boundary
banged in short on middle at 145ks, blocked back to the bowler
short and outside off, eased to point
short and down leg at 143ks, Latham chases before pulling his bat away. Wide
shortish and slides in with the angle, blocked solidly to cover
short and outside off at 143ks, hustles Latham. He leans back to cut, and edges it behind. Dribbles past the stumps to the keeper
back of a length and outside off, played on the up but straight into the covers
tripe ball sliding down the leg side, Guptill goes low and sweeps in the gap, splitting the two men behind square. Just helped it on its way
slides on, pushed back to the bowler
flatter and on the pads, Guptill unleashes another sweep, and hits it behind square
Dilshan strays on the pads again, tapped back to the bowler
quicker and shorter on middle and off, Guptill makes room, punches to mid-off
darted on the pads, driven down to long-on
Guptill seeks to make room and free up the off side, the bowler follows him. Awkwardly fended to leg
short and width, Guptill lays into it and lashes it past the covers
slapped away but Dilshan comes into play on the field. Dug in outside off at 144ks, Guptill rises on his toes and cuts it with Dilshan taking a good catch, diving low to his left
back of a length and outside off, KW lets it pass
short and Chameera pings the channel, ignored
short and hustles on off at 141ks, makes KW play. Fended to cover
floated full on middle at 120ks, crisply driven back to the bowler, who deflects it towards the covers
pitched up on off, KW plays late and pats it in front of the covers
shortish and on off, KW twirls his wrists, and manipulates it to short midwicket
pitched up and outside off, no real swing, KW strides forward, meets the pitch. Eased to mid-off
KW gets across off and flicks this shortish ball down to long leg
veering onto the pads, milked through backward square leg
short and angled in, blocked
short and outside off, Latham swats it away behind square, off the top portion of the bat
back of a length and on middle, turned to square leg
shortish ball just a shade outside off, late-dabbed away towards slip
back of a length and outside off, KW rides the bounce. Steered away to third man
back of a length and outside off, tapped towards backward point
short and wide outside off, cut away to backward point. KW slashes a cut to backward point and sets off. Dilshan makes a diving stop but fails to throw the stumps down
bumper down leg, boings off the surface to the keeper
shortish and outside off, Latham gets on top of the bounce, and punches it in the gap at covers. He times the pants off it, full marks for placement as well
keeps it short and outside off, cut away off the back foot through point
rising ball on a leg-stump line, Latham swivels back and pulls it fine on the leg side
back of a length and on off, Kula isn't getting any swing here. Blocked back to the bowler
Kula bangs another bouncer, it sails over the left shoulder of KW
slower-full ball outside off at 106ks, Latham is early into the shot, mis-hitting a drive past short cover
back of a length and outside off, back-cut away to the covers, where Siri I guess throws himself to his left and stops the ball
Latham ventures down the pitch, the bowler bangs it short and surprises the batsman. Nearly popped back for a return catch
dug in down leg, helped behind square for a pull
bouncer, leaps over a ducking KW. Wide called
back of a length and on off, KW snaps his wrists and flicks in front of square
back of a length and outside off, solid punch into the covers
back of a length and on off, punched back to the bowler
shortish and on the hips, KW short-arms it away to long leg
length ball on off, punched past short cover, to mid-off
Latham just clears mid-on. Latham dances out, meets the full ball, and sends it skimming over the fielder with a lofted on-drive
back of a length, angled in, and seams away past the outside edge
Latham looks for a tap-and-run single in front of cover. No dice
short and outside off, KW gets on top of the bounce and punches it into the covers. Timing - A+ but placement not all that good
dug in again, KW targets the leg side and takes it on the thigh
classy stuff from KW! He hits the gap now. He shuffles away outside leg and punches it between backward point and the covers, square of the wicket. From the middle of the bat
an encore! Slower ball outside off, KW uses his feet, waits, adjusts and slaps it away past the covers
four, four, four! Back of a length and outside off, another punch. He plays late and places it to the left of backward point. KW is toying with his opposite number
back of a length and on off, punched back to the bowler
flighted on off, gently patted in front of point
full on middle, down the track and worked to mid-on
pitched up on off, defended back to the bowler
worked through square leg for one
Dilshan errs short and outside off, duly dispatched. Latham skips back and pulls it strongly over midwicket
Dilshan spears it in at 89ks, off the pad and sneaks away behind square on off
full at off, worked to midwicket
skiddy ball on off, nudged to midwicket again
full and outside off, Latham saunters down the pitch and eases it past the covers. Sweet cover-drive
darted on off, pushed back
swept to backward square leg
flatter and on the pads, helped away to long leg with a sweep
full and on middle, pushed to mid-off
tossed up, tapped down the ground
Latham employs a sweep and sends the ball to long leg
down the pitch and dabbed to silly mid-on
spins back in, pulled to the same fielder
dragged short, Latham stands tall and forces it back to the bowler

tossed up towards leg and it's driven before it turns to the cow corner where the fielder slides to try and keep it in but he went past the boundary cones before his second attempt to keep the ball in, so that's a four
length delivery towards the off stump now, KW defends it back
flighted on off and KW comes down to drive it to sweeper cover, with the turn
slightly flatter down the leg side, past Latham's sweep for a wide

Latham connects the sweep this time but he top edges it to fine leg, that's a soft dismissal! It was an innocuous delivery down the leg side and Latham tried the sweep again, the ball took the leading edge to go high and Pradeep did well to go forward and to his left to get his hands under it
beats him first ball! Just hint of turn for the length ball that drew Taylor forward to defend but the ball spun past the outside edge

got him this time, caught at slip, Taylor has gone for a duck! There was a bit of flight, it was just outside off and Taylor decided to go back this time to push it into the off side but the ball spun away marginally and took the outside edge to head to Mathews at slip who grabbed it with both hands
some room outside off, KW slices it towards deep point for one
angled in slightly and Nicholls is off the mark by tucking it towards midwicket
KW waits for it to turn in a bit and helps it to the leg side or one
comes forward to the pitch of the ball outside off and drives it into the covers for one
rocks back to punch the ball into the covers but mistimes it a bit to short cover
flighted on middle, he comes down now and pushes the ball with the turn to silly mid-on
turning in a bit with flight, pretty full, Nicholls tucks it to leg and it deflects off midwicket for one
takes a step down and drives the ball with the turn to long off
pretty wide outside off, no turn and Nicholls cuts it away to deep point for one
not too short, KW pulls and drags it onto his stumps
makes it a low full toss by coming down and clips it wide of mid on for one
flighted and low full toss on leg, Nicholls sweeps and that deflects off short leg for one more. Hit him on the foot
drifting in a bit towards middle and leg, KW defends it to midwicket after coming down
flights it into the batsman, Nicholls pushes it gently into the covers
full and towards middle and leg again, pushed down to mid-on
outside off this time and Nicholls tucks it towards cover point
some flight outside off for the length ball, he pushes it to point
nicely bowled again outside off, not much pace and he finds cover point this time
angling in this time towards the stumps, he goes back to defend it. That's a maiden
flighted well outside off, KW comes down to take it ont he full and digs it out to cover

that's gone high, tough chance for long off and put down! KW miscued it after coming down the track, the ball was in the air for a while and Kapugedara ran fast to his right from long off, put in a full-stretch drive to his right and got his hands to it but it popped out! What a catch it would have been to dismiss KW!
on the back foot and steers the ball behind square
stays back and cuts the ball to deep point for one
some room on the off side, Nicholls unleashes a reverse sweep after all those dot balls in the last over and guides it past short third man in the gap for four!
flight and drift towards middle, helped to midwicket for an easy single
touch flatter outside off, Nicholls sweeps it behind square on leg for one
shorter one on the stumps, KW rocks back and whips it behind square for one
leans forward a bit and pushes the length ball into the covers for one
towards middle and leg on length, tucked straight to midwicket
slightly fuller and turning in, flicked to square leg this time with the turn
absolutely full outside off, he digs it out to cover
full again, closer to off now and it's pushed back past the bowler who dives to his right and makes KW lose his bat
more towards leg, Nicholls takes it on the pad outside leg
well outside off now and it's steered to deep point for one
some room for KW too outside off and he drives the ball into the covers for one
some flight on the middle and leg, he leans forward and defends it to leg
just short of length towards off, pushes it to deep midwicket off the back foot for one
flighted around off, Nicholls comes down and pushes it to mid off for a quick single
some turn this time into KW who stays back to help it down to long on
gets some room, makes some room by backing away and cuts that to deep point for one
turning it towards middle stumps, KW waits and tucks it to square leg
mid off is up, last ball of the over and KW dances down to loft that over the fielder's head for a one-bounce four!
full toss down leg, Nicholls sweeps it behind square and there's a fumble there but they take only one
shortish outside off, easily worked to deep cover for one more
presses forward and blocks the ball on off
low full toss on off and he sweeps it away to deep square leg for one
takes a tiny step down and drives it firmly to long off
fullish on middle and Nicholls takes out the sweep again for a single
comes down a bit and drives it against the turn to mid on
turning in a bit towards off and it's pushed down to long on
lots of flight for the full delivery outside off, Nicholls drives and gets a thick edge along the ground behind square where short third man dives to his right to save a few
shortish outside off, rocks on the back foot and punches that to cover point
some flight for the length ball, he comes down and drives it to long on easily
angling in towards middle, he makes room and cuts it to deep point for one
bangs it in short around off and Nicholls defends it off the back foot
short of length angling in towards off, Nicholls steers straight it to point

oh, the angle has worked, Nicholls has dragged one on! Nicholls didn't move much for that and was looking to push at that outside off, the ball was angling away but he played outside the line and the inside edge made the ball crash onto the leg stump
angles it away from the left-hander, he lets it go to the keeper
full and wide, he drives that nicely in the gap to get off the mark
back of length now without much room and he defends it into the covers
angling in from wide of the crease, he pushes it to mid off and a fumble leads to a single
pretty full around off and he whips it down to long on
back of length and turning away from off, steers it off the back foot to sweeper cover
flighted and full on middle, flicked straight to midwicket
sharp turn this time from well outside off, this was shorter and wider and he looked to cut but the turn beat him. Wasn't too far from the inside edge or the stumps
coming in closer to the stumps and it's tucked towards midwicket for one
on length on the off stump and Santner defends it on off
back of length outside off now and it's defended towards cover
some room and Santner uses that to steer it to deep cover for one and that's NZ's 150
opened up KW a bit as he looked to flick the ball to leg but the ball might have held its line just a bit to take an edge to the off side
more towards the pads and it's flicked to midwicket this time
excellent stop from Dilshan with a dive to his right at point. KW punched that off the back foot as he got some room but couldn't clear Dilshan
flighted on the stumps, Santner comes down and drives it down to mid off, who's at the edge of the circle, for a quick single
KW comes down too with some room and drives the full ball with the turn to long off
a little short, a little bit of room and he chops it off the back foot for one
lot of flight outside off, it's full and wide too and KW waits before driving it all along the ground and right in the gap for a four to bring up his fifty
no room this time and KW defends it back to the bowler
what a beautiful straight drive after coming down the track to take the ball on the full, Pradeep does well to dive to his left from mid on and saves a few
back of length outside off, KW punches it towards cover
not much room again and he steers it to cover again
too short this time and not too far from off stump, KW rocks on the back foot and swivels there to pull it in the gap, over the midwicket fielder for four!
makes room this time to find a gap on the off side but defends the ball that is angled in, back to the bowler
short of length outside off, pushed just past extra cover for a quick single
right on the off stump and Santner defends it on the leg side

oh my, KW has given it away, he has slapped a full toss straight to mid-on! He came down the track as Siriwardana angled it in from round the wicket and KW swatted the waist-high full toss to mid-on where Chameera pouched it around his waist height
full outside off, driven into the covers and he's off the mark straightaway
drives the fullish delivery down to long on
hint of away turn outside off, he waits and steers it past point for one
turning into the batsman now, he hangs back and tucks it behind square for one more
pretty full on off and it's driven straight back to the bowler
good pace and he angles it away from just short of good length outside off, he pokes and misses
bit of room outside off and he runs it down to third man this time

bangs in the short ball, Ronchi goes on his toes with a horizontal bat and the ball goes off the glove to his helmet before heading to third man for one. It took the back-padding near the neck off the helmet and Ronchi makes adjustments to put it back
length delivery on middle and he defends it close to the pitch
tries to swat this away from middle and finds mid on for one
another bouncer and this one's down leg for a wide
short again around off and Ronchi defends it back, off the back foot
heading down the leg side, brushed off the thigh to the keeper
full and on middle, defended
slides on outside off, Santner shapes for a cut.. and only connects with thin air
loopier on middle, spins in, defended back
Santner dances out, he is nowhere close to the pitch, as he takes it on the pad
darted onto the leg stump, Santner aims to sweep, off the pad and sneaks away behind square
pitched up and on middle, driven to mid-off for one
dug in short on off, Ronchi aims to pull, he does not get hold of it, as the ball goes only as far as mid-on
back of a length and on off, jabbed away to midwicket
full and outside off, laced to deep cover
shortish and outside off at 141ks, Ronchi cuts it in the air. Dilshan flings to his left but can't pull off the catch. It was a difficult chance, though
keeps it short and outside off, steered towards point
shortish and spins away, Ronchi tunes up for a cut, and mistimes it back
darted flat and quick, punched to mid-on
flat non-turning ball outside off, forced down to long-off
flighted on middle, Santner twinkles down the pitch, lifts it over mid-off and sends it clattering into the sightscreen
Vandersay's length goes wonky, low full toss on the pads, slog swept to the cow corner boundary
Santner dashes down the track again. He manufactures a full toss and drives it down the ground, to long-on
good length ball around off, forward and tapped to backward point... Dilshan is lurking there and NZ won't chance a single
very full and on the pads, whipped to the right of deep square leg
back of a length and on middle, guided down to third man

the short ball works for Pradeep. Banged in as Pradeep hits the middle of the deck, and hurries Ronchi onto the pull. He skies it over the square leg umpire off the front foot, hit high on the bat. Kapu settles under the ball; another single-digit score for Ronchi
full and outside off, draws Santner into a loose drive, edged past gully
full and aimed at off, pushed to mid-off
drifting down leg, Santner is dragged into a sweep. He loses his balance and misses the shot
skids off the surface with extra bounce, chopped to cover
fuller and down leg, helped to short fine leg with a paddle sweep
pitched up on off, driven back to the bowler
slides on outside off, chopped away to deep cover off the back foot
fired down the leg side again, Santner still can't connect with a sweep
full and on the stumps, pushed down the ground
straighter one, clipped to midwicket
length and outside off, poked between the keeper and a floating slip/gully off an outside edge, beats third man as well
short, rising ball on off, fended to point
back of a length and outside off, struck to deep cover
proper, proper cut. Short and kicks up outside off, Bracewell leaps, gets on top of the bounce, and strokes it in front of square

was that ducking down leg? Not given lbw. SL want a review. Full, slings in, and beats the inside edge to rap the front pad as Bracewell shuffles across and does not connect with a flick. The tracker confirms that it was heading down the leg side
yorker, nailed at the base of off at 147ks, squirted to mid-off
full toss, Vandersay escapes punishment. Swiped to deep midwicket
Vandersay gives this more air on middle, Bracewell uses his feet and flicks through midwicket
whipped from a fourth-stump line to backward square leg
length and turns away outside off, steered to the off-side sweeper
fired on middle and leg, tapped down to long-on
worked through midwicket, Bracewell pushes on for two and they take it
back of a length and on middle, dropped in front of cover for a quick one
Bracewell slithers across off to meet this back of a length ball. Defended into the covers
back of a length and on off, pushed to short cover again, Bracewell exploits the misfield from Thiri and dashes across to the other end
banged on a leg-stump line, tucks Santner up for room and socks the body

dug in short again, this is around off. Santner pulls and misses, he is smacked above the waistline as the ball dribbles onto the pitch, adjacent to the off side. Chameera, though, runs in, swoops down, and under-arm flicks onto the stumps, despite a desperate dive from Santner after turning back. Bracewell had called for a single, but Santner, who does the splits, can't drift back to the crease in time. Sharp work from Chameera
hurled on off at 145ks, blocked to cover
flat on off, punched back to Siri
Bracewell steps out and yorks himself. Jabbed to midwicket
spinning into the pads at 77ks, slipping down
Sir targets the leg stump again, Milne misses the flick and takes it on the pad
Siri errs short, this sat up to be hit. Milne rocks back and pulls it over square leg
width outside off, cut to deep cover now
bouncer down the leg side, ducked under. Wide
full at off, slapped back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts to deep cover
back of a length on off, whipped to deep square leg
lifter outside off, Milne sways back and lets it pass
back of a length and on off, weak punch to cover
leg-stump ball, swept down to long leg, Vandersay gets across to his right, dives, but can't prevent the boundary
flat length ball, turned to leg
darted outside off, slashed past cover
drifts in on middle, whippy drive between deep midwicket and long-on, Bracewell gets two
darted on middle and leg, jabbed to long-on. They have to settle with one here
turn for Siri, poked towards point off a leading edge as the leg-side flick flops

Chameera messes up! Back of a length, sticks in the pitch and stops on the batsman, who chips a flick to midwicket. Chameera is probably late to react, he dives forward, but the ball dips on him. He should have attacked the ball
back of a length, shuffles across and takes it on the pad
swing and a miss outside off
back of a length and outside off, punched to covers
back of a length and on off, glided to third man
short ball on off, nudged to leg for one
full on middle and leg, clipped past midwicket
back of a length ball on off, which is chopped to third man
slanted down leg, wide
full and straight, whipped to midwicket
dug in outside off, swat-pulled it away to deep midwicket
canny slower ball on middle and leg, only at 100ks, bunted to midwicket
full and on middle, pushed down to long-on for one
back of a length and outside off, Bracewell has a mighty whoosh at it... and misses

Bursts through the hands and hits the mouth. Dropped by Gunathilaka. Back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, swiped to deep square leg, where Gunathilaka clangs the chance. Talk about adding injury to insult
slanted down the leg side, off the pad, but the keeper dives to his left and has it covered
Milne swings hard and gets an inside edge onto the pad, which dribbles to off
low full toss, hacked to deep midwicket
full and on middle, Milne steps away, creates some room and lofts it down the ground.. Not middled, though
Milne skips out and drives a single to long-on to bring up the 250 for NZ
the batsman shuffles away outside leg, cutter, punched to the covers
Milne exposes his stumps by getting across off but this is pushed down leg, wide
yorker on middle and leg, squeezed out to long-on
full and on middle and leg, heaved to long-on
Milne wants to mow it over leg after slinking across and making room. Leg-side wide
Milne uses his feet, but has to wait for the slower ball to arrive. Dragged to long-on
full and on middle, Bracewell dances out and loft-drives it over mid-off. Long-off hunts it down
Bracewell holes out to Senanayake off a full toss. Slogged into the lap of the sub fielder. Little New Year's present for Sena
full and fired outside off, hoicked to long-on
looks like a slower ball, dragged through midwicket off the inside half
Sixer Southee tees off! First boundary since the 45th over. Half-volley on middle and leg, Southee gets under it and swings over long-on
and again! Length ball outside off, Southee sizes it, and pastes it over long-off now
Southee finishes the innings with six,six, four! Slower ball on off, slugged away behind square, beats the diving fielder

inn2.comm: fullish outside off, Gunathilaka drives it gently but with good timing between cover point and point for three. There were no threes taken in the first innings
tries to adjust the line but sends it down leg for a wide
length delivery without any swing outside off, pushed into the covers
goes wide of the crease to angle it in towards the stumps, it was on length again, and Dilshan drove firmly but got an inside edge to the leg side
tries a bouncer but that's also down leg for a wide
shaping away a bit outside off, Dilshan drives it firmly a bit wide of mid off for one
towards the pads on length, tucked towards midwicket
much better from Southee - outside off with no room and Gunathilaka defends it towards mid off for a quick single
angles it away with a fullish length outside off, he swings and misses
more room this time with a similar length and Gunathilaka cashes in by driving that nicely through the covers, all along the ground for four!
shorter and closer to the batsman, he defends it into the covers for another quick single. Good strategy from Gunathilaka
148kph, angling in towards middle and leg, helped to fine leg off the pads for one
length delivery angling away from outside off, left alone this time
146kmh, swings as he sees some room outside off, it wasn't quite full length, and he misses
shaping away a bit, he didn't time it very well down the ground and it deflected off the stumps for one
appeal for a catch down the leg side, there was a sound for sure, and Bowden calls it a wide. Gunathilaka looked to tuck it fine and looks like there was some pad on that
outside the off stump now and it's defended into the covers
pulled away, it's gone all the way! It was short outside off, Gunathilaka spotted it early and got into a good position to pull it to the midwicket boundary for six!
room outside off now, he throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge in the air! Lands in front of third man
pretty wide outside off, Dilshan drives away from the body and doesn't middle it very well
it was going down leg, pretty full and Dilshan flicks it away in the big gap on the leg side easily for four!
148kph, there's width again and Gunathilaka drives that beautifully, using the pace of the ball, to send it racing away through the covers for four!
148kph, not too wide, he throws his bat and gets a thick edge well over where a second slip stands for a quick four, fine on the off side
151kmh, back of length and angling away, he swings again and finds mid off this time

run out chance at non-striker's end! Gunathilaka pulled the short ball late to short fine leg and took off for the single. He was then caught watching the ball instead of running full throttle. No direct hit, luckily for him
errs down the leg side for a wide
another quick single - back of length around off and Dilshan's bat came down just in time to defend to leg and Gunathilaka responded early for the run
angling away a bit outside off, on length, he defends into the covers
short from Southee, Dilshan pulls it fine on the leg side and that just about beats a diving fine leg for four!
short of length and swinging away outside off, he lets it go
targets the stumps this time and Dilshan defends it towards mid on
some room again, Dilshan swings and Santner dives to his right from cover point to stop that
back to the stumps and Dilshan flicks that uppishly behind square and in the gap for four more! Southee erring a lot today
length delivery outside off, mistimes a cut to cover

that's gone over the sight screen! What a way to welcome the new bowler! It wasn't full at all outside off, there wasn't room either so Gunathilaka drove it down absolutely straight for an elegant six
this one is angled across from length and left alone
touch closer to the off stump, he runs it down to third man for one
cutting in slightly from outside off, back of length this one, and Dilshan cuts it to backward point
touch fuller outside off, he pushes it down to mid off
swings and misses! Just back of length outside off, he tries to punch it through the covers and doesn't connect
just a bit of room for the back of length ball and he cuts it to point
even shorter outside off, he goes at it again and finds cover point this time
fullish outside off, that's been dispatched straight down the ground for another six! Right from the middle of the bat as he swung hard at it and the fielders didn't have to bother
cracking four! Short of length outside off and he gets room to open up his arms, after waiting on the back foot to cut it square for four more
back of length now with lesser room and he defends it towards point
he goes short again and Gunathilaka sends that over the covers with another big swing for four more
tries the scoop and gets only some bat. They scamper for a quick single as the ball drops close to the pitch and they take a second with the help of Ronchi's overthrow
touch shorter and Dilshan flicks it wide of deep midwicket and calls for two early, good response from Gunathilaka to come back in time
it's short and it's pulled to deep midwicket after a bounce for one
it's on off, bit of room and he swings nicely to find extra cover
slow and full offcutter to beat Gunathilaka's outside edge as he swings again
it's a packed off side field and he sees a bit of room to caress that along the ground, right between point and cover point and that's his fifty only in the eighth over
right on the stumps from MM and Dilshan defends it back
short ball, Dilshan pulls late and finds short fine leg
falls in his follow through, MM, but found a good line and length on middle. Dilshan pushed it down to mid on for a quick single
short ball, he pulls and the ball lobs towards short cover
another short ball and this one is pulled behind square to long leg for one
short ball to end the over too and it's pulled under control to deep midwicket for one
full and aimed at off, Dilshan goes low for his signature Dilscoop, he can only toe end it behind square
pitched up and on middle, that's defended back to the bowler
full again on middle, blocked
banged in short on a leg-stump line, Gunathilaka swivels on the back foot and pulls it over backward square leg; one-bounce four. Controlled hit
full and on middle, patted to mid-off
full and just a shade outside off, run away behind point
length ball on the off stump, he defends it back
short ball on the leg side, he pulls it behind square for one
short ball angled in and it's defended towards midwicket for a single
bangs in a short one again and Dilshan fends it off the hips, looking for two, but has to settle for one
the short balls are not going to stop, and neither will Gunathilaka! Gets a bouncer, he hooks and even though he top-edges it, he gets enough to send that over the short fine leg boundary
outside off with some room, punched to cover this time
drops just short of deep square leg! The length ball on middle was swept and it went in the air for a while, deep backward square leg ran to his left but it was out of his reach
towards middle and leg and it's defended towards midwicket
shortish outside off with room and he steers it late behind square for two
shuffles across and defends the ball to leg
fuller on the stumps and he defends it back to Santner
makes room to cut but manages only a bottom edge to the keeper
shortish towards the hips and it's tucked behind square for one
cutting in slightly from outside off, he guides it to third man for one
back of length on middle, Dilshan tucks it towards midwicket for one

the stand is broken, Gunathilaka has handed it straight to slip! The ball was short with some room, Gunathilaka stayed back and chopped it late, to guide it to third man, but it went straight to Taylor at wide slip. McClenaghan is pumped!
length delivery outside off, it's driven right into the covers
just back of length outside off and he defends it on the off side
drifting in from round the wicket, Dilshan drives the full ball down to long off
length delivery outside off, Thirimanne defends towards point
steers that wide of point off the back foot as he gets some room
coming in towards the stumps, he leans forward and blocks
pushes that softly into the covers and gets a quick single
just back of length on off and Thirimanne punches it down to long on for one
short ball without any room, Thirimanne defends it close to the pitch
short of length and on the off stump, he defends it back to MM
goes wide outside off to tempt Thirimanne, he goes down on a knee with a big swing and misses
towards the off stump, no room at all, and Thirimanne defends solidly
stays back this time and pushes the back of length ball to mid off with a straight bat
gets some room and drives that nicely, to deepish cover for one
length and on off, tapped to mid-off
fullish and outside off, charming bent-knee drive, but straight to cover
short and down leg, just 128ks, not enough pace to threaten Thiri. Pulled through backward square leg
fractionally short and on off, Dilshan does not have enough room to work with. He isn't in good touch either. Jabbed into cover
and again! Back of a length and on off, Dilshan leans back and finds cover
back of a length and on off, Dilshan dabs this one to the left of short cover, he succeeds in getting the single
back of a length and on off, punched down the pitch
width outside off, that's Dilshan's snugly blanket, cracked past cover
back of a length and on off, Dilshan throws his bat at it, and hits it to mid-off
short ball on off, again at only 128ks, and this ball as aged as well. Pulled in front of square
pitched up on off, front-foot push towards point
full and wide outside off, sliced drive, nearly carries to point
length and on off, twirled behind square for one

Southee roars a caught-behind appeal! Full and angled away outside off, Thiri goes for an expansive drive and does not connect as the ball whistles past the outside edge. Ronchi throws a stare at Southee, almost like: 'what are you roaring for'. Quite an appeal, that
short ball, rises outside off, Thiri rises with it and ramps it over backward point, to third man
dug in short, pulled behind square on leg
back of a length, punched wide of cover
similar length, Thiri rides it to point from an off-stump line
full and decks in, clipped to mid-on
full and on off, Dilshan looks to drive hard and mis-hits it back to the bowler
dug in outside off, Dilshan rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square
short ball outside off, Thiri leaps and finds point. He keeps finding fielders
Ah, I spoke too soon. Thiri hits the gap. Short ball on off, pulled over the square leg umpire
back to finding fielders in Thiri. Short and width, should have been parcelled up and dispatched. Instead, Thiri cuts to point
slid down the leg side, Dilshan employs a sweep and sends it square of short fine leg
flat and quick on the leg stump, whipped forcefully through midwicket
three successive fours! drifting into the pads, Dilshan slams a sweep over midwicket and acknowledges his fifty
Santner held this one back outside off, Dilshan dabs to point
tucked off the pads to midwicket
full and on off, wristy drive to long-off
length and swerves in, Dilshan may have got an inside edge onto the pad. Yes, he managed some bat on it, and the pair sneak a run, thanks to an overthrow
back of a length on off, blocked to cover
short, ball gets big on Thiri. He hops and fends it in front of midwicket
full and comes in to strike the pad, but this was slipping down. Dilshan almost topples over the flick
back of a length on off, Dilshan is forward, defending to mid-on
short ball, punched in front of midwicket. The 39-year old Dilshan scampers across for the single
hint of turn outside off, knocked through point
nudged to midwicket off the back foot
Thiri comes down the pitch and quietly works this full ball back to the bowler
Thiri makes room now, cutting this from the stumps to backward point
short on off, punched in the gap at cover
heading down leg, helped on its way fine
back of a length and on middle at 142ks, Thiri shows the full face of the bat, and punches down the ground. Solid shot
this is even better! Shortish and around off, Thiri sends it skimming past cover. It is hauled in before the boundary.. Thiri, though, runs only a couple
short and attacking the ribs, pulled up and over midwicket
short ball again, turned to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, hit on the up but straight to cover point
short at outside off at 141ks, Thiri is late to pull it away. The result is a feeble top edge over square leg
turns away outside off, dabbed to backward point
full and on middle, bunted through midwicket
sliding down leg, paddled fine for one. Just a single
back of a length and on off, Dilshan snaps his wrists and secures a single to midwicket
width outside off, eased to deep backward point
Dilshan gets forward and milks another single to midwicket
banged in short, Dilshan pulls a single to deep backward square leg
back of a length and on middle, played back to the bowler
length and outside off, punched to cover
picked away off the hips through square leg
short ball outside off, Thiri keeps his eyes on the ball, rocks back and pulls over midwicket
full and ducks back in, clipped behind square
short and comes in, knocked to mid-on
wicket-to-wicket line, forward and pushed to mid-on
Bracewell sucks pace off this ball on off, gentle nurdle to midwicket
back of a length and on off, punched... Santner dives to his right and makes a smart save
length ball on off, turned to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punchy drive to sweeper cover
full and angled in, flicked through backward square leg
short-ball attack from round the stumps to the left-hander. Thiri hops and drops his wrists on it
not all that short outside off, swivel-pulled behind square
length and angled in, pushed to covers
shortish and outside off, flayed past backward point
glanced off the hips to short fine leg
Dilshan clears mid-on. Cross-seam full ball on off, lifted over the fielders, as the ball trickles to the boundary
full ball again, Dilshan drags it behind square off an inside half
back of a length on off, chopped to point
hurled on middle, pushed to mid-off. Sloppy stuff as New Zealand concede an overthrow
short and on off, Dilshan keeps his eyes on the ball and pulls to deep square leg
a tad overpitched and on middle, Thiri plays a charming drive down the ground, beating the bowler and mid-on
angled in, tapped to the right of midwicket
short and outside off, Thiri upper cuts it... It lands in front of the forward-diving third man fielder
Dilshan hops and clips this length ball to midwicket. Thiri sets off for the second, Dilshan isn't interested. Thiri turns back and slides, the throw wasn't accurate though
banged short, pulled in front of square
Dilshan rides the bounce of this short one on off and helps it to third man
full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
starts off with a leg-stump ball, which is tucked around the corner
slides on middle, Thiri camps back and punches it solidly to long-off
short ball, darted down leg, pulled to long leg
hint of width outside off, cracked to deep point
back of a length, turned behind square
this one keeps low outside off, Thiri aims to cut and bottom-edges it towards point
full and on off, pushed back to the bowler
high-ish full toss outside off, Dilshan can't reach out... The slower ball backfires. No-ball
fractionally short, slow ball. Dilshan reads it, and belts it to the midwicket boundary
full, Dilshan goes hard on the drive and pushes to cover
lifter outside off, Dilshan can't ramp it away. Not sure why Mitch appealed
short and outside off, carved behind point
slower-ball bouncer, helped to short fine leg
well outside off and he steers it to backward point
fuller on the off stump and he defends it to the same fielder
slightly shorter on off, he rocks back to cut it past point this time
Dilshan tries to cut off the back foot too, but misses
defends on the off stump now and gets an inside edge to leg for one
hint of turn with the length ball on off and middle, Thirimanne defends on the off side
nothing changes as he is welcomed with another four! 125kmh, fullish around off and Dilshan drives it down past Southee to beat both mid on and mid off for a four
whips the incoming delivery this time to leg for one
pretty full outside off, and it's driven straight to extra cover
back of length just outside off and he guides it to third man for one more
on length close to off, it's pushed down towards mid off for one
some room outside off and Thirimanne drives it into the covers
gives a lot of flight outside off, and Dilshan drives it away from the body for one
almost in the block hole on middle, blocked back to KW
fullish around off and it's pushed into the covers
gets some room and steers it with the turn to sweeper cover

run out appeal and Dilshan has to put in a dive, NZ look confident! Dilshan tucked the ball that was turning in to backward square leg and took off for the single that never existed, so was sent back and an accurate throw meant he had to dive in the end, but it wasn't enough
pitches it on length on the stumps, he defends it back
bit of room outside off and he cuts it late to beat short third man to get two and that's his fifty
stays back again and cuts this one to deep backward point for one more
pitched up on the pads and it's defended down towards mid on
defends the length ball towards point and takes off for one
pushes the ball back towards mid on and Santner dives to save a run, also throws it back to the keeper
comes out of the crease and pushes the length ball to cover
fullish on the off stump, clipped to midwicket with the turn
pushes this one towards point and they sneak in a quick single

tiny appeal for caught behind as it goes down the leg side and there was some noise. No reaction from the umpire and KW wants to review it. "Can't really see too much there," says the third umpire after watching the Hot Spot and asks for RTS (Real Time Snicko). Snicko shows something as the ball passes the bat, but the bat soon hits the ground as well which makes the replays "inconclusive" and the not out decision stays. And now it's called a wide too
offers some room on the off side and it's cut away easily to deep cover for one
tossed up well outside off, pushed down to long on easily
this one's going down leg too and it's swept along the way to fine leg
full toss with a lot of room, Chandimal decides to only drive it to deep cover for a single
thick outside edge runs past backward point as Chandimal looks to defend the turning ball in front of off
fullish delivery outside off and it's pushed down to long on
outside off again and it's placed in the gap this time, using soft hands only, past point for two quick runs
gives the charge to take it on the full and drills it downa gainst the turn, just past Thirimanne for a four
leans forward this time to defend it into the covers
marginally outside off and it's defended into the covers
sees some room and Thirimanne cuts it to deep cover for a single
pretty full now and it's pushed down to long on
just outside off on length, he makes room and cuts again to free his arms
pitched up on the stumps and Chandimal clips it just past midwicket for another single
too flat and wide, Thirimanne chases and gets bat on it but only finds point
towards the leg side now and it's swept away to fine leg for one
plenty of room for Thirimanne to go down on a knee and drive it to deep cover for two
turning in a bit from outside off, touch shorter and it's placed to point
on length around off it's turned to the leg side for another one
more room this time and it's pushed into the covers for a single
targets the stumps this time, no room and it's defended close to the pitch
another one on the stumps and it's defended towards midwicket again, Santner gets to it quickly
enough room to free his arms and he swings the bat to find deep cover
fullish on the stumps, pushed back just past KW, to long on for one
pitched up outside off now and it's driven in the air between cover point and point
he makes room this time and works it down to long on again
poor delivery down the leg side and it's swept fine by Thirimanne, McClenaghan has to chase it from fine leg, he does so and dives too, to save a run but has done something to his hamstring
outside off from KW, cut to deep point for one
flighted on the stumps, he presses forward and defends

he's dropped a sitter! Chandimal's left hand came off the bat as he almost slogged after coming down the track and miscued it down the ground. Sodhi was at deepish mid off and he probably lost it in the sun. He was under the ball but couldn't hold on to it properly
outside off and defended towards cover point
fuller this time outside off and he defends again
good stop at backward point as Thirimanne cuts off the back foot but can't clear the fielder
angled across the batsman outside off, he cuts and misses
length ball outside off and it's pushed into the covers
plenty of room outside off, Thirimanne slams it past cover for one
cuts it late from outside off and finds backward point
makes some room this time and works it to midwicket
well outside off again, he goes on the back foot and pushes the ball to cover
offers room to Thirimanne and he punches it to deep cover
just outside the off stump and it's defended to point
short of length this time towards off, he works it off the back foot to midwicket
length ball turning in from outside off, steered late to short third man
towards the off stump, this time Thirimanne unleashes a reverse-sweep and finds the narrow gap between short third man and backward point to collect four
clips this one down to long on with the turn
fullish on off and pushed back to KW
some room outside off and it's pushed into the covers
pitched up, Thirimanne wants to get over with it and slogs that from just outside off to the long on boundary for six!
tossed up on leg now and it's worked down towards mid on for one
quicker and flatter outside off, nudged to cover point for one
he goes after it again with a slog since it was pitched up and that nearly went to midwicket for a catch. Fell short, maybe, and deflected off him to mid on
angling in towards the off stump, he defends it down to mid on
on length outside off and it's pushed down to mid off this time
covers the stumps and steers the length ball from off to point
another dot ball as Bracewell sends down a yorker and Chandimal digs it out to midwicket
follows the yorker with a bouncer and he sways out of the line, it's called a wide for height, though
follows the bouncer with a full delivery on the pads, it's clipped away with a flick in the gap before KW chases it all the way and keeps it in with a slide
full delivery to end the over, it's driven back to the bowler and it deflects off his shoe towards midwicket
pushed straight into the covers
length ball on the off stump, he defends softly and wants one but is sent back
towards the pads now and it's helped to long leg for one
flighted full toss outside off, it's slammed straight to short cover
full toss again outside off and it's driven to short cover yet again
shorter now outside off, he waits and steers it past point for one
it's short of length with some room, Thirimanne square drives it late to send it behind point, and third man runs a fair bit to his left to keep it to two with a dive

short ball, pulled and it's been sent racing away to the cow corner boundary for four. That's it, SL win by eight wickets and keep the series alive. The two batsmen meet each other and exchange a few words, as if another 100 runs are left, and finally congratulate each other, before walking back
